result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven B Huppert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs to be paid $50.00 per month commencing 09/01/2022 and each month thereafter or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice address to: Steven Huppert Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward.
Reminder Notice: Steven Huppert Return to Sender, No Such Number, Unable to Forward.

02:01 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Steven B Huppert in court with attorney J Andrew Herbers.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.  Court confirms with Atty. Herbers that defense is prepared to proceed and will rely on the plea questionniare filed  back on 06/30/2022.  Atty. Herbers confirms.  State recites the offer.  Atty. Herbers confirms the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, Court finds defendant guilty.

Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Gordon.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Herbers.
Defendant presents statements.
Atty. Herbers notes the defendant still has the GPS monitor on and inquires if based on the matter resolving today it can be removed.
State has no issue with it being removed.
Court advises the defendant can report to WCS after court today to have GPS removed as the matter has resolved.

COUNT 1:
The Court Orders the Following:

30 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (45 Days Credit) - TIME SERVED

COSTS: $343.00 (includes DV surcharge);
	
DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 09/01/2022.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Hearing on February 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 0.5 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

04:05 PM Defendant Steven B Huppert in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for February 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
